Column Comment.0: INTERVAL IDENTIFIER: unique identifier for the interval or the interval velocitydescribed in the row of data.
Column Comment.1: ACTIVE INDICATOR: A Y/N flag indicating whether this row of data is currently eitheractive / valid (Y) or inactive / invalid (N).
Column Comment.2: BASE DEPTH: Measured depth from the surface to the bottom of the test interval.
Column Comment.3: BASE DEPTH OUOM: Base measured depth original unit of measure.
Column Comment.4: STRATIGRAPHIC UNIT IDENTIFIER: unique identifier for the stratigraphic unit.
Column Comment.5: COMPUTE METHOD: Code identifying the method used to compute velocity (e.g.,C=checkshot seismic).
Column Comment.6: EFFECTIVE DATE: The date that the data in this row first came into effect.
Column Comment.7: EXPIRY DATE: The date that the data in this row was no longer active or in effect.
Column Comment.8: LAST UPDATE: Date the last time the vendor updated the entity production data.
Column Comment.9: ROW_MANAGEMENT_GUID: This value may be used to provide a global uniqueidentifier for this row of data. Use of this column is not mandatory, but if used,optional PPDM NOT NULL and UNIQUE INDEX constraints provided in the datamodel DDL should be created.
Column Comment.10: REMARK: Narrative remarks about this row of data.
Column Comment.11: REPORTED TRUE VERTICAL DEPTH: The reported depth of a well measuredvertically from the surface to the point of interest in the well bore. These reportedvalues may not represent the actual TVD as derivable from the directional surveyandmay consequently be in error.
Column Comment.12: REPORTED TRUE VERTICAL DEPTH ORIGINAL UNITS OF MEASURE:
Column Comment.13: SEISMIC SET: A seismic set is a super type of various types of seismic collections.Valid types of seismic sets include SEIS_LINE, SEIS_3D, SEIS_SEGMENT andSEIS_SURVEY.
Column Comment.14: SEISMIC SET SUBTYPE: The seismic set type column is used to enforce arelationship between the SEIS SET supertype and its valid sub types. Values for thiscolumn must be the name of the table that is the valid sub type for this row ofdata.Valid entries include SEIS_LINE, SEIS_SEGMENT, SEIS_SURVEY, SEIS_PLAN,SEIS_WELL, SEIS_PROC_SET, SEIS_INTERP_SET or SEIS_3D.
Column Comment.15: SEISMIC TIME DATUM: Seismic time datum is an arbitrary reference surface orlocation that has been corrected for irregular topographic effects from which timesand depths are measured in milliseconds.
Column Comment.16: SEISMIC TIME DATUM OUOM: Seismic time datum original unit of measure.
Column Comment.17: SOURCE: The individual, company, state, or government agency designated as thesource of information for this row.
Column Comment.18: STRAT NAME SET IDENTIFIER: Unique identifier for the stratigraphic name set. Astratigraphic name set is an unordered collection of stratigraphic units, that may be inuse for a Lexicon, a geographic area, a project, a company etc.
Column Comment.19: TOP DEPTH: Measured depth from the surface to the top of the test interval.
Column Comment.20: TOP DEPTH OUOM: Top measured depth original unit of measure.
Column Comment.21: STRATIGRAPHIC UNIT IDENTIFIER: unique identifier for the stratigraphic unit.
Column Comment.22: UNIQUE WELL IDENTIFIER: A unique name, code or number designated as theprimary key for this row.
Column Comment.23: VELOCITY QUALITY: Subjective measure of the quality of this velocity data, such asgood, fair, poor, questionable etc.
Column Comment.24: VELOCITY TYPE: The type of seismic velocity. Horizontal velocities and verticalvelocites are typical types.
Column Comment.25: VELOCITY VALUE: Value for the vector quantity which indicates change ofdisplacement, the propagation rate for a seismic wave (not implying any direction).Reported as interval or average velocity.
Column Comment.26: VELOCITY VALUE OUOM: Velocity value original unit of measure.
Column Comment.27: ROW CHANGED BY: Application login id of the user who last changed the row.
Column Comment.28: ROW CHANGED DATE: System date of the last time the row was changed.
Column Comment.29: ROW CREATED BY: System user who created this row of data.
Column Comment.30: ROW CREATED DATE: Date that the row was created on.
Column Comment.31: ROW_EFFECTIVE_DATE: A system assigned date that specified when a row of datais effective from a systems perspective. This may be the date that a row of data wasmade available to end users, for example.
Column Comment.32: ROW_EXPIRY_DATE: A system assigned date that specified when a row of data isno longer effective from a systems perspective. This may be the date that a row ofdata was no longer available to end users, for example.
Column Comment.33: PPDM ROW QUALITY: A set of values indicating the quality of data in this row,usually with reference to the method or procedures used to load the data, althoughother types of quality reference are permitted.
